channel.title: I got this error when compiling [317]

item.title: I got this error when compiling [317]
item.dc:creator: @Trent1 Trent!!
item.description:
@Trent1 wrote:

Mental Piracy:

You cannot declare public methods inside another method. You either have to make them localized(IE do what Jayden suggested). Or if you plan on calling them in other places just put them outside of the method. If they are going to be used just for this command make them local variables.

ok, i compiled and got no errors. but when i do the command, nothing happens .___.

Read full topic

item.title: I got this error when compiling [317]
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

Mental Piracy:

You cannot declare public methods inside another method. You either have to make them localized(IE do what Jayden suggested). Or if you plan on calling them in other places just put them outside of the method. If they are going to be used just for this command make them local variables.

Jesus, couldn’t have said it better myself.

@JaydenD12 wrote:

Remove the “public” identifier on the arrays.

item.source: I got this error when compiling [317]

item.title: I got this error when compiling [317]
item.dc:creator: @Trent1 Trent!!
item.description:
@Trent1 wrote:

client.java:8327: illegal start of expression
public int[] plateBody = {13654};
^
client.java:8328: illegal start of expression
public int[] shields = {8001};
^
client.java:8329: illegal start of expression
public int[] plateLegs = {14519};
^
3 errors
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

when i added these two codes, though i shouldnt be getting an error.

if (command.startsWith("armour"))
{
public int[] plateBody = {13654};
public int[] shields = {8001};
public int[] plateLegs = {14519};
	addItem(randomPlateBodys(), 1);
	addItem(randomShields(), 1);
	addItem(randomPlateLegs(), 1);
}

and


		public int randomPlateBodys() {	return plateBody[(int) (Math.random() * plateBody.length)];
	}
		public int randomShields() {	return shields[(int) (Math.random() * shields.length)];
	}
		public int randomPlateLegs() {	return plateLegs[(int) (Math.random() * plateLegs.length)];
	}

Read full topic
